titles.title: Congressional Voting Accountability Act
Congressional Voting Accountability Act
To amend the Rules of the House of Representatives to prohibit remote voting and voting by voice and to require a recorded vote on any question put before the House, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

bill.summary:
Congressional Voting Accountability Act
This resolution amends the Rules of the House of Representatives to eliminate proxy voting and remote committee activity, to require a recorded vote for any question put before the House, and to require affirmative or negative votes for record votes in the House.
The resolution also requires the Chair to entertain a point of order that a quorum is not present during general debate.
